title: 8.3 Keep on dreaming - kgt34
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollecties voor Engels voor vmbo kgt, leerjaar 3 en 4. Dit is thema 8 'Dreams'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: Keep on dreaming. Deze les staat in het teken van de betekenis van dromen en en droomsymbolen. De onregelmatige werkwoorden in deze les zijn: to throw, to understand en to wake. In de grammaticaopdracht wordt de 'conditionals' behandeld.

items.content:
Het onderwerp van dit blokuur is de betekenis van dromen.

  • Maak groepjes van drie of vier leerlingen.

Bespreek de volgende vragen in jouw groepje:

  • Wat zou het kunnen betekenen als je droomt dat je achterna gezeten wordt?
  • En als je droomt dat je valt?
  • Kan je nog meer dingen bedenken waar je van kunt dromen?

Onder andere met deze vragen ga je aan de slag in deze opdracht.
Bekijk hieronder de stappen die je gaat zetten.

Succes.

Step activiteit
activity		 leerdoel
aim		 tijd
time
introduction Je gaat nadenken over wat je al weet. 5
Step 1

listening
Typical symbols in dreams

 Je kunt een video over droomsymbolen begrijpen en er vragen over beantwoorden. 15
Step 2

reading
Dreams explained

 Je kunt een tekst over de betekenis van dromen begrijpen en er vragen over beantwoorden. 15
Step 3 vocabulary and irregular verbs Je leert vocabulaire over dromen en kunt die gebruiken. De onregelmatige werkwoorden: to throw, to understand en to wake. 15
Step 4

grammar
Conditionals

 Je kunt de conditionals gebruiken 10
Step 5

speaking
Talking about dreams part 3

 Je kunt een gesprek voeren over dromen. 10
Step 6

writing
Symbols in dreams

 Je kunt een e-mail schrijven over betekenis van dromen. 20
Step 7 evaluation Nadenken over wat je geleerd hebt. 5
Step 8

extra
Sweet dreams

Symbols in dreams

You are going to watch a video about frequently occurring events in dreams.

  • Watch the video and do assignment 1.
  • Read the statements.
  • Watch the video again and do assignment 2 and 3.

Assignment 1

Watch the video and answer the question on your own, then discuss the answer in your group.

  • How many symbols are discussed in this video?

Statements

  1. Only the symbols in this video occur in dreams.
  2. Only scientists can interpret dream symbols.
  3. Being chased is one of the most common dream symbols.
  4. The next symbol is failing an exam.
  5. If you dream about falling you might loose control over a situation.
  6. If you dream about killing you will become a murderer.
  7. The people you dream about represent aspects of yourself.
  8. There are no symbols about sex in dreams.

content.body:
Are the following statements true or false?

  1. Only the symbols in this video occur in dreams.
 True False
  1. Only scientists can interpret dream symbols.
 True False
  1. Being chased is one of the most common dream symbols.
 True False
  1. The next symbol is failing an exam.
 True False
  1. If you dream about falling you might loose control over a situation.
 True False
  1. If you dream about killing you will become a murderer.
 True False
  1. The people you dream about represent aspects of yourself.
 True False
  1. There are no symbols about sex in dreams.
 True False

Luister en kijk nog een keer naar de video en sleep de ontbrekende zinsdelen naar de juiste plek.

Here are some of the typical symbols we in dreams. In a common way of understanding what they might mean. Know that symbols are best interpreted by you, the dreamer within the context of the dream itself. But these can get you started:

  • So we start with , it's one of the most common dream symbols in all cultures. It can mean you're feeling threatened. So reflect on who is chasing you and why they might be a posssible thread in your real life.
  • Exams they can signify self-evaluation with the content of the exam reflecting the part of your personality or life that is .
  • The falling is a common dream symbol and it can relate to our anxieties about letting go, loosing control over a or somehow failing after a success.
  • Killing in your dreams doesn't make you a closet murderer. It represents or can represent your desire to kill a part of . It can also symbolise hostility towards a particular person and desire to see them suffer.
  • People in your dreams or other are reflections of your own psyche and may demonstrate specific aspects of your own personality.
  • Now here is an interesting one: . They can symbolise intimacy and a desire for sex , an unfulfilled desire or they may demonstrate the unification of unconscious emotions, with conscious regognition showing a new awareness and personal growth.

So, these are just a few symbols and you can find more down below this video.

items.content:
Dreams explained

You are going to read a text about dreams.

  • Read the text and do assignment 1.
  • Read the text again and do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

Read the text and do the assignment on your own, then discuss the answer in your group.

Find the English words for the Dutch translations underneath in the text.

  • droomuitleg
  • dromen over beroemde mensen
  • dromen over de dood
  • dromen over vliegen
  • dromen dat je valt
  • rondlopen in een leeg huis
  • kiespijn

Dreams explained

We sleep in cycles which include "deep sleep", during which we don't dream, and "dreaming sleep" in which we have hallucinations which we call dreams. Every ninety minutes or so we have a period of REM (rapid eye movement) sleep during which we dream. This REM sleep lasts for up to half an hour.

Dream interpretation has been a subject of intense interest for thousands of years. Dreaming about famous people means that you are bored with your social life and would like to have more fun. If you mix with the celebrities in your dream as an equal this indicates that you have high self-esteem. If you interact with the stars in a subservient way then you have little confidence in yourself. Similarly, dreaming that you are at a party or get-together is interpreted differently depending on whether you felt at ease or awkward there.

Dreams about death can represent a new start in life; maybe you are changing jobs, moving house or starting a new relationship. Dreaming about flying is very common and may represent a wish to escape from a situation. If you dream that you are falling it may mean that you are not looking forward to something in the immediate future and that you feel powerless to avoid it. This type of dream is often experienced before events such as tests or exams and new beginnings such as getting married or starting a new job.

They say that if you dream that you are wandering around an empty house it may reflect a subconscious uneasiness or anxiety in your life, and if you dream about losing your teeth it may originate from deep-seated memories of your own teeth falling out when you lost your "milk teeth", or may indicate that you have a little toothache which is not painful enough to break through into your conscious mind.

The word "dream" does not only refer to hallucinations which occur when we are asleep. It can also refer to an ambition or an ideal state of affairs. It was used as such by the famous social justice campaigner, Martin Luther King (1929-1968), in many of his speeches when he said, "I have a dream." When Irving Berlin (1888-1989) wrote I'm Dreaming of a White Christmas in 1942, he was undoubtedly using the word in this sense rather than as a reference to dreaming during sleep. Victorian poet and critic, Matthew Arnold (1822-88), described Oxford as "that sweet city with her dreaming spires" in Thyrsis, a poem he wrote in 1866.

Bron: www.englishclub.com

items.content:
Bestudeer de woordenlijst.

Woordenlijst Keep on dreaming


Tip!
Er zijn verschillende manieren om woordjes te leren.
Je kunt de woorden hardop voorlezen of overschrijven.
Het belangrijkste is dat je dit niet te lang achter elkaar doet, want dan leer je niets meer.
In twee keer 10 minuten leer je meer dan in een half uur.

Irregular Verbs

Bestudeer de volgende drie irregular verbs (onregelmatige werkwoorden):

  • to throw
  • to understand
  • to wake

Doe de twee opdrachten.

content.body:
Sleep de woorden naar de juiste plek in de tabel.

What do we experience in dreams?

Wat we in dromen?

Symbols are best interpreted by you.

Symbolen kunnen het beste door jou worden .

Exams can signify self-evaluation.

Examens kunnen dat je jezelf beoordeelt.

Does a dream show what you desire?

Laat een droom zien wat je ?

We sleep in cycles which include "deep sleep".

We dromen in cycli "diepe slaap".

A lot of people are interested in dream interpretation.

Veel mensen zijn geïnteresseerd in .

They interact in a subservient way.

Ze gaan met elkaar om.

I felt akward in that situation.

In die situatie voelde ik me .

Flying means you want to escape from a situation.

Vliegen betekent dat je uit een situatie wil ontsnappen.

Something might happen in the immediate future.

Er kan iets gebeuren in de .

Wandering around an empty house may indicate a subconscious uneasiness.

Rond een leeg huis lopen kan wijzen op een .

There might be an anxiety in your life.

Er kan zijn in je leven.

Your dreams may originate from deep-seeted memories.

Je komen kunnen ontstaan door .

Vertaal het Nederlands in het Engels.

  1. I always dream I am (wordt achtervolgd).
  2. Exams can (betekenen) self-evaluation.
  3. Something might happen in the (nabije toekomst).
  4. Dreams about death can (staan voor) a new start in life.
  5. We sleep in cycles (waaronder) "deep sleep".
  6. A lot of people are interested in (droomuitleg).
  7. Flying means you want (ontsnappen) from a situation.

items.content:
Conditionals

In deze les behandelen we (nogmaals) de Conditionals.

  • Bekijk de uitleg in de kennisbank.
  • Maak daarna de twee opdrachten.

Conditionals

items.content:
Talking about dreams - part 3

Discuss the questions in your group:

  1. Do you usually remember your dreams? Why/ Why not? Describe some of them.
  2. What was your nicest dream that you can remember?
  3. Talk about a recurring dream that you have had in the past.
  4. How do you interpret a dream? Do you use your intuition/imagination to understand it?
  5. Have you ever had or heard of a dream that foretold the future?
  6. Do you tell people about your dreams?
  7. Do you usually have dreams? What are they like?

Symbols in dreams

Je hebt een video gezien over de betekenis van dromen, Typical symbols in dreams. Je vond dit nogal interessant nu wil je graag weten hoe je penvriend(in) hierover denkt.

  • Maak de schrijfopdracht eerst alleen, daarna vergelijk je jouw e-mail met die van je groepsgenoten.
  • Schrijf een e-mail met je groepje en lever deze in bij je docent.

Je gaat een e-mail schrijven aan je penvriend(in) in Engeland.

Verwerk de volgende punten:

  • Bedenk een naam voor je penvriend(in).
  • Groet je penvriend(in).
  • Vertel welke video je gezien hebt.
  • Noem twee voorbeelden uit de video (meer mag ook).
  • Vertel wat je leuk vond aan de video.
  • Vraag wat je penvriend(in) hiervan vindt.
  • Verzin zelf iets om aan je penvriend(in) te schrijven.
  • Schrijf een passend slot.
  • Schrijf je naam onder de e-mail.

Vul het schema in en beantwoord de vragen onder het schema.

Activiteit leuk niet leuk makkelijk moeilijk weet ik al nieuw
Listening
Reading
Vocabulary
Grammar
Speaking
Writing

  • Waar moet ik nog aan werken?
  • Wat moet ik nog aan mijn docent vragen?

Sweet dreams

You are going to listen to the song Sweet dreams by Beyoncé.

Watch the video.
